title: How to Make Chicha Morada

steps.headline: Wash and peel the apples and pineapples.
steps.description: Save the peels and peeled fruit. Wash the lemons and purple corn, too.

steps.headline: Take the cinnamon, whole cloves, apple and pineapple peels, and all the purple corn.
steps.description: Put them in a 3 quart pot filled with 4 cups of water.

steps.headline: Boil the purple corn mixture for 45 minutes.
Strain the juice into a separate 3 quart pot.
steps.description: Refill the first 3 quart pot with another 4 cups of water.

steps.headline: Reuse the solid purple corn mixture from the first batch.
steps.description: Add 4 cups of water. Boil again.

steps.headline: Let the mixture sit for a half hour or until cooled.
steps.description: The heavier piece of corn and fruit mixture will settle to the bottom as the liquid rises to the top of the pitcher. This will make the beverage smoother to drink.

steps.headline: Take both mixtures and pour them into the pitcher that can hold a gallon and a half of liquid.
steps.description: Put the container with all of the strained liquid into the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Take the cooled drink out of the refrigerator.
Add 1 cup of sugar.
steps.description: Add more until it is suitable to your taste.

steps.headline: Cut the four lemons.
steps.description: Squeeze the juice out of the lemons into drink, to taste.

steps.headline: Serve the beverage in a glass.
steps.description: If desired, add a piece of pineapple that has been cut up.

text: Wash and peel the apples and pineapples. Save the peels and peeled fruit. Wash the lemons and purple corn, too. Take the cinnamon, whole cloves, apple and pineapple peels, and all the purple corn. Put them in a 3 quart pot filled with 4 cups of water. Boil the purple corn mixture for 45 minutes.  Stir occasionally.  Strain the juice into a separate 3 quart pot. Refill the first 3 quart pot with another 4 cups of water. Reuse the solid purple corn mixture from the first batch. Add 4 cups of water. Boil again. Let the mixture sit for a half hour or until cooled. The heavier piece of corn and fruit mixture will settle to the bottom as the liquid rises to the top of the pitcher. This will make the beverage smoother to drink. Take both mixtures and pour them into the pitcher that can hold a gallon and a half of liquid. Put the container with all of the strained liquid into the refrigerator. Take the cooled drink out of the refrigerator.  Add 1 cup of sugar. Add more until it is suitable to your taste. Cut the four lemons. Squeeze the juice out of the lemons into drink, to taste. Serve the beverage in a glass. If desired, add a piece of pineapple that has been cut up.
